bibl.title: Egipetskaja podveska, najdennaja na gorodišče Čajka (severo-zapadnyj Krym) i posmertnoe obožestvlenie Arsinoi II Filadel'fy. Avec résumé en anglais: An Egyptian Pendant from the Settlement "Chayka" (North-Western Crimea) and the Posthumous Divinization of Arsinoe II Philadelphos.
bibl.note: A pendant of blue glass found in 1993 during the excavations of the Greek settlement "Chayka" (near Evpatoria, North-Western Crimea) probably presents a couple of "Brother-and-Sister Gods", i.e. Ptolemy II and Arsinoe II Philadelphoi.
bibl.seg: LADYNIN I.A. i E.A. POPOVA, Egipetskaja podveska, najdennaja na gorodišče Čajka (severo-zapadnyj Krym) i posmertnoe obožestvlenie Arsinoi II Filadel'fy. Avec résumé en anglais: An Egyptian Pendant from the Settlement "Chayka" (North-Western Crimea) and the Posthumous Divinization of Arsinoe II Philadelphos.

A pendant of blue glass found in 1993 during the excavations of the Greek settlement "Chayka" (near Evpatoria, North-Western Crimea) probably presents a couple of "Brother-and-Sister Gods", i.e. Ptolemy II and Arsinoe II Philadelphoi.
